snippet: An Indian-American celebrity sociologist draws critics.
abstract: An Indian-American celebrity sociologist draws critics.
lead_paragraph: “From his earliest days as a graduate student, Sudhir Venkatesh did things differently. He came to sociology by way of math, not by the social sciences. He was an Indian-American Deadhead from Southern California who wore a ponytail and tie-dyed shirts. He stuck out.” Ariel Kaminer wrote in The New York Times.

headline.main: Sudhir Venkatesh, Columbia’s Gang Scholar, Lives on the Edge
